_comment: Created by NCODowd on 16/11/2016 17:22:49 using v2.7
title: How has the number of managerial staff in the NHS changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
Contrary to popular belief, there has been a substantial decrease (20%) in the number of managers and senior managers employed within the NHS. In September 2009 there were 11,892 senior managers and 25,687 managers, which have dropped to 9,497 and 20,691 respectively in July 2016.

Updated November 2016
